page.title: 20Conservation area,Murroes
page.content:
The area at{Murroes Den}which includes the church, doocot and castle has been made a conservation area by Dundee district council. This means that many outside repairs or cutting down trees may need permission from the council. The{church,}which has existed since the 13th century, was gifted by Gilchrist, Earl of Angus, to the Abbey of Arbroath, but was rebuilt in 1648 and again in 1848.{Murroes House or } {Castle}was built in the early 17th century, more for comfort than defence. In the den nearby is a {doocot,}which once provided the castle with pigeon meat during the winter.
The information on these pages was compiled in June 1985 by children from {Mattocks School,}Wellbank and{Murroes} {School. }
